text: Quick question.

Have you sent money to
friends or family this year?

There are many
platforms that make

it easy to send money
to family in the US,
such as Zelle and Venmo.

But for a large portion of the
world, sending money to family
is a nightmare.

My name is Kingsley,
co-founder of CashEx.

When I moved from
Nigeria a few years ago,

I found it very difficult
sending money to my family.

TransferWise seemed
to be the best option,

but high fees were hidden in
their poor exchange rates.

And with every
transaction, about 10%

of the value being
sent was lost.
And it's not just me.

African migrants lose
$8 billion every year

to fees that are the
highest in the world.

According to the UN, if they
were charged the same rates

as everyone else,
the money saved

could put 14 million children
through primary school
education.

The market side is
also very large.

African migrants send $80
billion to Africa every year.
And this is how CashEx was born.

CashEx matches transfers by
African migrants with transfers

by African businesses
and nets them

in such a way that international
transfer fees are eliminated.

And we have validated this
idea with an early prototype.

We transacted over
$400,000 for 600 users.

And we did this purely by word
of mouth with no marketing
spend.

We experienced building
software for currency exchange
and doing business in Africa.
Thank you for your support.

We are CashEx, zero-fee
transfers for migrants.
